org.fujion.plotly.plot

Class PlotCarpet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.plotly.plot.PlotOptions
        • org.fujion.plotly.plot.PlotCarpet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOptionMapTransform, IClientTransform

    public class PlotCarpet
extends PlotOptions
    Options for carpet plot.

    A carpet plot is any of a few different specific types of plot. The more common plot referred to as a carpet plot is one that illustrates the interaction between two or more independent variables and one or more dependent variables in a two-dimensional plot. Besides the ability to incorporate more variables, another feature that distinguishes a carpet plot from an equivalent contour plot or 3D surface plot is that a carpet plot can be used to more accurately interpolate data points. A conventional carpet plot can capture the interaction of up to three independent variables and three dependent variables and still be easily read and interpolated.

    • Field Detail

      • a

        @Option
public double[] a
        An array containing values of the first parameter value.

      • a0

        @Option
public Double a0
        Alternate to "a". Builds a linear space of a coordinates. Use with "da" where "a0" is the starting coordinate and "da" the step.

        Default: 0

      • aaxis

        @Option
public final ABCAxisOptions aaxis
        Style options for a axis.

      • b

        @Option
public double[][] b
        A two dimensional array of y coordinates at each carpet point.

      • b0

        @Option
public Double b0
        Alternate to "b". Builds a linear space of a coordinates. Use with "db" where "b0" is the starting coordinate and "db" the step.

        Default: 0

      • baxis

        @Option
public final ABCAxisOptions baxis
        Style options for b axis.

      • carpet

        @Option
public String carpet
        An identifier for this carpet, so that "scattercarpet" and "scattercontour" traces can specify a carpet plot on which they lie.

      • cheaterslope

        @Option
public Double cheaterslope
        The shift applied to each successive row of data in creating a cheater plot. Only used if "x" is been omitted.

        Default: 1

      • color

        @Option
public String color
        Default for all colors associated with this axis all at once: line, font, tick, and grid colors. Grid color is lightened by blending this with the plot background Individual pieces can override this.

        Default: "#444"

      • da

        @Option
public Double da
        The a coordinate step. See "a0" for more info.

        Default: 1

      • db

        @Option
public Double db
        The b coordinate step. See "b0" for more info.

        Default: 1

      • font

        @Option
public final FontOptions font
        The default font used for axis & tick labels on this carpet.

      • x

        @Option
public double[][] x
        A two dimensional array of x coordinates at each carpet point. If ommitted, the plot is a cheater plot and the xaxis is hidden by default.

      • xaxis

        @Option
public String xaxis
        Reference between this trace's x coordinates and a 2D Cartesian x axis. If "x" (the default value), the x coordinates refer to "layout.xaxis". If "x2", the x coordinates refer to "layout.xaxis2", and so on.

      • y

        @Option
public double[][] y
        A two dimensional array of y coordinates at each carpet point.

      • yaxis

        @Option
public String yaxis
        Reference between this trace's y coordinates and a 2D Cartesian y axis. If "y" (the default value), the y coordinates refer to "layout.yaxis". If "y2", the y coordinates refer to "layout.xaxis2", and so on.
